results:
Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about "Lalka" (The Doll), the 1968 film directed by Wojciech Jerzy Has starring Beata Tyszkiewicz. Here's what the search revealed:

**"Lalka" (The Doll) is a 1968 Polish film directed by Wojciech Jerzy Has.**(no content)The film is an adaptation of the novel "The Doll" by Bolesław Prus, which is regarded by many as one of the finest Polish novels ever written.

**Cast and Characters:**
The film follows a nouveau riche merchant, Stanisław Wokulski (played by Mariusz Dmochowski), through a series of trials and tribulations occasioned by his obsessive passion for an aristocratic beauty, Izabela Łęcka (played by Beata Tyszkiewicz).(no content)In 1968 Beata Tyszkiewicz was cast in The Doll, directed by Wojciech Has.

**Plot and Setting:**
The Doll constitutes a panorama of life in Warsaw between 1878 and 1879, and at the same time is a subtle story of three generations of Polish idealists, their psychological complications, their involvement in the history of the nineteenth century, social dramas, moral problems and the experience of tragic existence.

**Beata Tyszkiewicz's Role:**
Beata Tyszkiewicz has worked mostly on the big screen but acted in several French TV movies, becoming famous through her portrayal of distinguished ladies in costume dramas like The Doll by Wojciech Has and The Ashes by Andrzej Wajda.(no content)Izabela Lecka (Beata Tyszkiewicz) and Stanislaw Wokulski (Mariusz Dmochowski) are represented just as good on screen as they were in the book.

**Film Details:**
The film has a running time of 153 minutes and was produced in Poland in 1968.(no content)The film is classified as Period Drama, Romance, and Psychological Drama.

The search successfully found detailed information about this acclaimed Polish adaptation of Bolesław Prus's classic novel, confirming Wojciech Jerzy Has as director and Beata Tyszkiewicz's starring role as Izabela Łęcka.
